title: Calories in a Ciabatta Bread
meta_description: Learn calories in a ciabatta bread (standard 250g loaf), plus carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition facts for better meal planning.
assumptions: Standard plain ciabatta loaf, approximately 250g, baked without added fats or toppings; values based on typical Italian-style recipe.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, recipe, and baking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 250g ciabatta bread loaf has about 650 kcal and 22.5g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: With olive oil drizzle (1 tsp per loaf)

faqs.q: How many calories in a ciabatta bread loaf?
faqs.a: About 650 kcal for a standard 250g plain loaf.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a ciabatta bread?
faqs.a: Around 125g total carbs, including 6.3g fiber, for a 250g loaf.

faqs.q: Is ciabatta bread high in protein?
faqs.a: Moderate at 22.5g protein per 250g loaf; mostly from wheat flour.

faqs.q: How does ciabatta compare to other breads calorie-wise?
faqs.a: Similar to baguette (250-280 kcal/100g); higher hydration makes it lighter but calorie-dense.

faqs.q: Does toasting change calories in ciabatta bread?
faqs.a: No, toasting doesn't add calories, but toppings like oil or butter do (e.g., +100 kcal with 1 tbsp butter).
